basics.name: Gabriel Vega
basics.label: Software Engineer | Full-Stack Developer | AI & EdTech Innovator
basics.summary: Experienced software engineer and educator specializing in full-stack development, AI integration, and educational technology. Proficient in C, C++, .NET, Blazor, Python, and AI-driven applications. Passionate about building scalable solutions, enhancing user experience, and integrating technology into education.

work.name: Fontana Unified School District
work.summary: Teaching computer science, software development, and AI concepts to middle and high school students. Developed a full-stack curriculum covering C, Python, .NET, and AI-driven applications. Integrated robotics (RoboBlocky, Linkbot) and led an after-school Unity game club to foster student interest in STEM.

work.name: Forever Casas Realty Investment Group
work.summary: Built a proprietary real estate investment analysis tool. Integrated AI-based property evaluations and predictive market analysis into the business model.

work.name: Freelance Developer
work.summary: Designed and developed software applications, specializing in .NET MAUI, Blazor, and AI chatbots. Built interactive learning tools and automated real estate investment calculators.

work.name: Coachella Valley Unified School District
work.summary: Directed a Middle-High School Robotics program, focusing on computer assembly and programming. Taught 7th-grade Math and ELD, integrating technology to improve student performance. Coached after-school soccer and VEX robotics.

work.name: Rippon USD (RUSD)
work.summary: Taught Math Integration and A.P. Chemistry while incorporating programming concepts. Advised the Arduino Robotics Club, mentoring students in robotics projects.

work.name: First Light Energy
work.summary: Contributed to Spring-based web application development (front-end and back-end). Supported Salesforce CRM integration and provided IT support to troubleshoot and maintain internal systems.

work.name: Corona Norco Unified School District
work.summary: Resolved over 100 IT work orders, delivered training sessions on educational technologies, and developed custom district webpages for improved communication.

work.name: Moreno Valley Unified School District
work.summary: Taught a range of subjects including introductory math and computer science, fostering technology-based learning approaches. Also supported extracurricular STEM activities.

work.name: Riverside Community College - Moreno Valley College
work.summary: Tutored college students in C++, assisting with programming concepts, debugging, and foundational problem-solving skills.

education.institution: Riverside Community College - Moreno Valley College

projects.name: EduSpinner
projects.summary: An AI-powered interactive educational tool integrated into Microsoft Teams, designed to enhance student engagement using gamification principles.

projects.name: BitCalc
projects.summary: A .NET MAUI-based binary math learning tool for Computer Science teachers and students, supporting multiple numeral systems and bitwise operations.

projects.name: C-Spark Programming Language
projects.summary: A simplified programming language designed to teach 5th-12th grade students foundational coding concepts using C.

projects.name: AI Resume Chatbot
projects.summary: Integrated an AI chatbot into a .NET MAUI Blazor web app that can answer questions about my resume and projects using GPT4All and Microsoft Semantic Kernel.

projects.name: Real Estate Investment Analyzer
projects.summary: A data-driven real estate investment evaluation tool that uses predictive analytics and AI-driven property assessments.

certifications.name: California Teaching Credential in Computer Science
